questions.text: If the mean of 5, 8, 10, 12, and x is 9, find x.

questions.explanation:
Arrange in order: 2, 3, 5, 7, 9
n = 5 (odd)
Median = (5+1)/2 = 3rd value = 5

Already in order: 10, 20, 30, 40
n = 4 (even)
Median = Average of 2nd and 3rd values
= (20 + 30) / 2
= 25

Count frequencies:
2 appears 1 time
5 appears 3 times (highest)
7 appears 1 time
8 appears 1 time
10 appears 1 time

Mode = 5 (most frequent)

questions.text: The mean of 6 numbers is 15. If one number 18 is removed, what is the new mean?
questions.explanation:
Sum of 6 numbers = 15 × 6 = 90
After removing 18: New sum = 90 - 18 = 72
New mean = 72 / 5 = 14.4

questions.text: Find the mean of first 5 natural numbers.
questions.explanation:
First 5 natural numbers: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5

Method 1:
Mean = (1+2+3+4+5) / 5 = 15/5 = 3

Method 2 (Formula):
Mean of first n natural numbers = (n+1)/2
= (5+1)/2 = 3

questions.text: If the mean of 10 observations is 50 and the mean of 5 observations is 60, find the mean of remaining 5 observations.
questions.explanation:
Sum of 10 observations = 50 × 10 = 500
Sum of 5 observations = 60 × 5 = 300
Sum of remaining 5 = 500 - 300 = 200
Mean of remaining 5 = 200 / 5 = 40

All values appear exactly once (frequency = 1 for all).
There is no value that appears more frequently than others.
Therefore, there is no mode.

questions.text: The mean of 5 numbers is 20. If one number 25 is added, what is the new mean?
questions.explanation:
Sum of 5 numbers = 20 × 5 = 100
New sum after adding 25 = 100 + 25 = 125
New mean = 125 / 6 = 20.83...

questions.text: If values x, x, frequency f is: Value: 10, 20, 30; Frequency: 2, 3, 5. Find mean.
The median of 5, 8, x, 12, 15 (in order) is 10. Find x.
questions.explanation:
Data in order: 5, 8, x, 12, 15
n = 5 (odd)
Median = Middle value = 3rd value = x

Given median = 10
Therefore, x = 10

questions.text: The mean of 8 numbers is 35. If 2 numbers 30 and 40 are removed, find the new mean.
questions.explanation:
Sum of 8 numbers = 35 × 8 = 280
Sum of removed numbers = 30 + 40 = 70
New sum = 280 - 70 = 210
New mean = 210 / 6 = 35

Frequency count:
3 appears 3 times (highest)
7 appears 2 times
9 appears 1 time
11 appears 1 time

Mode = 3

questions.text: If all values in a dataset are increased by 5, what happens to the mean?
questions.explanation:
When all values are increased by a constant k, the mean also increases by k.

Example:
Original: 2, 4, 6; Mean = 4
New: 7, 9, 11; Mean = 9
Increase = 5
